entry.title: Combined summary - Bitcoin Wiki
entry.summary: In a Bitcoin-development mailing list thread from 2011, users discuss the unreliability of the wiki for storing Bitcoin Improvement Proposals (BIPs). Nils Schneider suggests using Git as a backup solution for BIPs, considering their importance and the previous issues with the wiki. Daniel F agrees with the idea of using Git and recommends utilizing Github pages, which automatically push Git commits to the website. Amir Taaki joins the conversation, seeking assistance in contacting MT to bring the BIPs back online. They mention that there is a new BIP to be added and they have not finished copy-editing the existing ones. Throughout the discussion, links to Github, Cisco Self-Assessment, and the Bitcoin-development mailing list are shared.In summary, the email conversation revolves around the use of Git as a backup for Bitcoin Improvement Proposals due to the unreliability of the wiki. There is a request for help in contacting MT to restore the BIPs, along with a mention of a new BIP and unfinished copy-editing work. The emails also include promotions for Cisco's Self-Assessment program, providing information about Cisco certifications, training, and career opportunities.
